doc.wiki: In computer science, an ABox is an "assertion component"—a fact associated with a conceptual model or ontologies within a knowledge base. The terms "ABox" and "TBox" are used to describe two different types of statements in knowledge bases. TBox statements describe a domain of interest by defining classes and properties as a domain vocabulary. ABox are TBox-compliant statements that use the vocabulary. TBox statements are sometimes associated with object-oriented classes and ABox statements associated with instances of those classes. Together ABox and TBox statements make up a knowledge base or a Knowledge graph.
